Header: Trump says relationship with NATO countries ‘very good’
Content: U.S. President Donald Trump defended his relationship with NATO countries after a summit meeting in London in which several NATO leaders were caught on camera appearing to disparage Trump. At a meeting with UN Security Council ambassadors at the White House, Trump said he has a “really good” relationship with other countries. He attributed tensions to his insistence that NATO countries pay a larger contribution of the organization’s budget. At a reception, Canada’s Prime Minister Justin Trudeau was caught on camera with French President Emmanuel Macron, Britain’s Boris Johnson and Mark Rutte of the Netherlands laughing at Trump’s long press appearances.
